column4: I want to use Ubuntu to fix errors on a NTFS partition. How can I do this?
you can force mount it or make a backup with dd but use windows to fix errors recover files etc
I've tried chkdsk, it crashes without fixing it
did you do a SMART test?
Disk Utility (from live cd) say's SMART is not supported for that drive
try "dd -if /dev/sd? -of /dev/null" , if ir errors out with a crc or something your drive is dead
dd to /dev/null did take a long time, but returned no errors
that would indicate your dive might be OK, it's just the FS that is mucked up
yeah, so thats good news. Thanks again for the advice
can you mount the FS at all?
yes, windows can boot, but it keeps BSOD-ing me. I've already backed up all important data
then the FS is not your problem it's windows
or if you backed up then just format reinstall
